availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Ann Bethurum. Father of Mary J. Bethurum, David Bethurum, James L. Bethurum, Margaret A. Bethurum, and Charley Bethurum. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky in 1850. Presiding Judge of Rockcastle County Court in 1860. Employed Emmanuel Mink as farm laborer in 1860. Served in Rockcastle and Lincoln County Home Guards as corporal from May 7, 1862 to July 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 166A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 515.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0472.
Find A Grave, "Benjamin Kincade Bethurum (28 Mar 1815-10 Jun 1903)," Memorial #18304493, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18304493 (accessed June 8, 2020).
